entries.meaning: (basketball) A close-range shot in which the shooter banks the ball off the backboard from a few feet away.

examples: Meeting the numbers will be a layup, if not a slam dunk.

entries.meaning: The state of being laid up.
examples: The ship endured an interminable layup in the harbor lasting nearly a month.

entries.meaning: (rail transport, countable or uncountable) A track used to store train cars.
examples: The caboose, long decrepit, rested on a forgotten layup just north of the dry riverbed.

entries.meaning: (rail transport) A train car sitting in storage (laid up), often overnight.
examples: Though I knew we shouldn't be there, she pulled me out of the tunnel and into the dark layup, its floors still grubby from the morning commute many hours ago.

entries.meaning: (materials science) The process of applying alternate layers of a material and a binding agent to form a composite material.
examples: Forgetting to clear the sawdust around his workshop, Payton ended up contaminating the resin-ply matrix with wood particles during his hand layup.
